Welcome to data_profiling’s documentation!¶

class src.DataProfiler.DataProfiler¶

Class for data profiling

convert_column(dataframe, column, convert_to='datetime')¶
Parameters:
  • dataframe – Dataframe with column to convert
  • column – Column to convert
  • convert_to – One of “datetime” and “categorical”. Specify column type to convert data to. Defaults to ‘datetime’ can also be ‘categorical’
Returns:

Converted column
Note:

Works only on ‘object’ (i.e. generic) type dataframe columns.
describe_columns(dataframe, columns, percentiles=[0.25, 0.5, 0.75], graph_types=['hist', 'density', 'pareto'], identify_outliers=True, exclude_outliers_from_graph=True)¶

Return a dictionary of column name to associated summary statistics

Parameters:
  • dataframe – DataFrame containing column(s) to describe
  • columns – Column(s) to describe in dataframe
  • percentiles – Percentiles (range 0 to 1) to calculate for summary statistics. This has effect only on numerical columns
identify_outliers(dataframe, column, column_stats=None)¶
Parameters:
  • dataframe –
  • column –
  • column_stats – If passed avoids calculating summary stats for data
Returns:

boolean array for outlier values
summary_stats(dataframe, column, percentiles=[0.25, 0.5, 0.75])¶
Parameters:
  • dataframe – Input data
  • column – Column to describe
  • percentiles – Percentiles for numerical column (range 0 to 1)
Returns:

Summary statistics for column
